dialogue: Well, we don't have a television but he's been here since before I was born and still doesn't sound like any American I've ever met.
Eight years ago, we tried opening something similar in Manhattan but we lasted just two months.
We couldn't compete with the name brands.
Newlyweds come in with an issue of Better Homes and Gardens and say, "We'd like that table next to the perfume ad."
We'd say to them, "well, we can make you something like that." And they say, "no sir, we want exactly that!" Turns out that we don't like New York at all. No charm, right Audrey?
Every little urchin you come across - seller, buyer, delivery boy - is running a hustle.
I'm from Connecticut myself. Do you know it?
Audrey, of course he doesn't know it. He just got here.
I cleared out some space for you in the back. Audrey made you a bed. There's just the cot and the lamp for now but feel free to take anything you want from the showroom.
I should put a muzzle on you.
Don't keep her waiting, cousin. It's her favorite song.
See! It's like riding a bike.
